oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Marriage procession for the wedding of Elizabeth Stuart, daughter of James I, and Frederick V, Elector Palatine
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Theater--England--London--History--17th century
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Elizabeth Stuart (1596–1662) and Frederick V, Elector Palatine (1596–1632) were married at the royal chapel at the Palace of Whitehall, London, on February 14th, 1613. Celebrations also took place afterwards in Heidelberg. This etching depicts the marriage procession; at the center, Princess Elizabeth walks with her brother, Charles I (1600–1649), who later became King of England, Ireland and Scotland.
